decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Phantasmagorian and Gitaxian Probe, allowing for powerful graveyard-based combos with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Dread Return. Cabal Therapy helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Force of Will provide protection. Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba work together synergistically to generate value from sacrificing creatures, while cards like Stinkweed Imp and Ichorid help with graveyard recursion. Prized Amalgam and Flayer of the Hatebound provide additional threats and win conditions.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by using powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Counterbalance, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also includes card selection and manipulation tools such as Brainstorm and Ponder to set up powerful plays, along with card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The win condition of the deck is to stabilize the board with Terminus and Entreat the Angels, while generating value with cards like Monastery Mentor and Predict.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to maintain card advantage and board presence by utilizing cards like Force of Will, Counterbalance, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By keeping the opponent's threats in check with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, the deck can stabilize and eventually win the game through powerful finishers like Entreat the Angels. The deck's main strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan and out-valuing them in the long run.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo quickly and efficiently. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Thespian's Stage, and Vampire Hexmage to create a 20/20 Indestructible Marit Lage token. In addition to the combo pieces, the deck includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Surgical Extraction to control the opponent's hand and library. The deck also has some spot removal in Abrupt Decay and Toxic Deluge to deal with threats on the board. Overall, the strategy revolves around executing the Dark Depths combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to play aggressively and quickly overwhelm the opponent with cheap spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Stormchaser Mage, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game as quickly as possible. With a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, as well as disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck can control the board and protect its threats. Price of Progress is included to punish opponents who rely heavily on nonbasic lands.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently poison the opponent with small creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent while also utilizing pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk to deal lethal damage in a single turn. The deck also includes permission spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base includes dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana production. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Gitaxian Probe and Brainstorm helps the player dig for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing and powering up Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by mana acceleration from Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponent's game plan, while cards like Dismember and Warping Wail provide removal and flexibility. The mana base is optimized for Eldrazi creatures, with lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple providing additional value. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage through drawing and manipulation. The deck aims to control the opponent's plays through cards like Force of Will, Counterbalance, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor while efficiently dealing with threats using Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. The deck also has a win condition through cards like Entreat the Angels and Monastery Mentor, allowing for a well-rounded and adaptable strategy to outplay opponents in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines such as Brainstorm, Sensei's Divining Top, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of powerful blue and white cards, along with a splash of red for additional removal and disruption options, the deck aims to maintain board control, answer threats efficiently, and ultimately win the game through card advantage and high-impact finishers like Entreat the Angels and Council's Judgment.

The main idea of this Legacy Reanimator deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Griselbrand and use spells like Exhume and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a powerful early game advantage. The deck also includes cards like Unmask and Collective Brutality to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own strategy. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate high-impact creatures and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Phantasmagorian, Golgari Grave-Troll, and Street Wraith in order to enable powerful graveyard synergies such as dredge, reanimation, and token generation using cards like Bridge from Below, Narcomoeba, Ichorid, and Prized Amalgam. This allows for explosive combo plays through cards like Dread Return and Cabal Therapy while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Chancellor of the Annex. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of creatures and graveyard interactions.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deploy threats such as Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Young Pyromancer while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Cabal Therapy. The deck focuses on efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to control the board and protect its creatures. With a mix of card draw and manipulation through Ponder, Brainstorm, and Gitaxian Probe, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo advantage throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through manipulation of the opponent's deck and hand while using card draw and counter spells to outplay them. The key strategy is to use cards like Lantern of Insight and Sensei's Divining Top to control the top of the opponent's deck, while utilizing Laboratory Maniac as a win condition. The deck also includes cards like Thought Lash and Terminus to control the board and force the opponent into unfavorable positions. By maintaining control of the game, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure a win through strategic planning.
